means: 恢复( revive的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: His trial revived memories of French suffering during the war.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的受审重新勾起了在战争中受苦受难的法国人民的回忆。

sentence.Network_en: The win revived glorious memories of his championship-winning days.
sentence.Network_cn: 这次胜利勾起了他对往昔那些夺冠岁月的美好回忆。

sentence.Network_en: With a glazed stare she revived for one last instant.
sentence.Network_cn: 她最后清醒了一会儿，眼神呆滞。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 石油词汇英语翻译(QR)--石油百科 ... revived structures 复活构造 revived 复活的 revivification of catalyst 催化剂复活.
听赫本的话 ... have to be restored,revived, 人更需要找回自我，重获新生， Never throw out anyone. 永远不要抛弃任何人。.
The article on Buddhism revived my interest in Oriental religions ., 那篇谈论佛教的文章重新燃起我对东方宗教的兴趣.
lifeguard revived the man by artificial respiration ., 救生员通过人工呼吸救活了那个人.

“哥特复兴（gothic revival）”(Gothic Revival)建筑的造型和细部都仿自中世纪的哥特(Gothic)风格。与“古典复兴”(Classical Revival)建筑注重理性、但外观.
在18世纪到19世纪的建筑文化与书写层面，所谓的「歌特复兴」（gothic revival），将中古世纪的阴暗情调从历史脉络的墓窖挖掘出 …

...国殖民风格中世纪传统——哥特风格中世纪传统——哥特风格(Gothic revival) 哥特风格( revival) 中世纪传统——古堡风格 Chateaue…

entry.tran: (使)复苏;(使)复兴;(使)恢复;(使)再次流行
entry.def: When something such as the economy, a business, a trend, or a feeling is revived or when it revives, it becomes active, popular, or successful again.

example.ex: ...an attempt to revive the British economy...
example.tran: 试图复兴英国经济的努力

example.ex: His trial revived memories of French suffering during the war...
example.tran: 他的受审重新勾起了在战争中受苦受难的法国人民的回忆。

entry.tran: 重新上演(戏剧、歌剧或芭蕾等)
entry.def: When someone revives a play, opera, or ballet, they present a new production of it.

example.ex: The Gaiety is reviving John B. Kean's comedy 'The Man from Clare'.
example.tran: 盖伊提剧院正在重新上演约翰·B. 基恩的喜剧《来自克莱尔的人》。

entry.def: If you manage to revive someone who has fainted or if they revive, they become conscious again.

example.ex: She and a neighbour tried in vain to revive him...
example.tran: 她和邻居想尽一切办法都没能让他苏醒过来。

example.ex: With a glazed stare she revived for one last instant.
example.tran: 她最后清醒了一会儿，眼神呆滞。

means.word_mean: 1. restored to consciousness or life or vigor;
2. given fresh life or vigor or spirit;

auth_sentence.content: But as prices recovered, projects were revived.
auth_sentence.res_content: But as prices recovered, projects were revived.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But as prices recovered, projects were revived.

auth_sentence.content: But Syria's crisis has revived Iraqi Shi'ite militant activity.
auth_sentence.res_content: But Syria's crisis has revived Iraqi Shi'ite militant activity.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But Syria's crisis has revived Iraqi Shi'ite militant activity.

auth_sentence.content: But Pistorius's selection has also revived a well-worn debate.
auth_sentence.res_content: But Pistorius's selection has also revived a well-worn debate.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But Pistorius's selection has also revived a well-worn debate.

Sentence.sentence: The way in which Mr Jobs revived the failing company he had co-founded and turned it into the world's biggest tech firm (bigger even than Bill Gates's Microsoft, the company that had outsmarted Apple so dramatically in the 1980s), sounds like something from a Hollywood movie.
